Broadcast is used for broadcasting messages between DroidScript apps.

CheckLicense.desc:
will trigger a standard Google Play license check for the running application (if it is a paid App).
The key can be found under “Development Tools > Services and API's” in the GooglePlay developer console.
If the App is not licensed it will show a dialog asking them to purchase the App from Google Play and then close the App.
CheckLicense.shortDesc: Checks if app is licensed with Google Play

CheckPermission.desc:
CheckPermission checks whether the permission of a particular component has been granted.

See Also: @GetPermission

ChooseAccount.desc:
Opens an Android dialog and allows the user to select one of the registered Google/Gmail accounts or add one. The selected email address is returned as the first argument in the callback function.

See Also: @GetAccounts
ChooseAccount.shortDesc: Let the user choose an google account

ChooseContact.desc: ChooseContact opens the Contacts app so that the user can select the name and either the phone number or email address of a user.
ChooseContact.shortDesc: Let the user choose an image

ChooseFile.desc:
ChooseFile opens a file picker for user to select a local file or a file from GoogleDrive, OneDrive or DropBox.

See Also: @ReadFile
pTypes: str:persist-keep file permission after reboot,nodownload-prevents file downloads

ChooseImage opens the photo gallery for user to select an image.

ClearCookies.desc:
ClearCookies clears the saved cookies for webviews or html apps.

See Also: @SaveCookies

ClearData.desc:
ClearData deletes variables saved via app.Save*(). The file parameter is optional. If given, the specified file will be used, otherwise it will be located in the apps private Folder.

See Also: @SetData, 

See Also: @GetData

ClearValue.desc:
ClearValue deletes a variable saved via app.Save*(). The file parameter is optional. If given, the specified file will be used, otherwise it will be located in the apps private Folder.

See Also: @SaveText, @SaveNumber, @SaveBoolean
ClearValue.shortDesc: Deletes a variable saved via app.Save*()

CloseDrawer.desc:
Closes the drawer layout on the given side with slide animation.

See Also: @OpenDrawer

CopyFile.desc:
CopyFile copies a file to a given destination. The target must locate to the actual target file, not the folder. An existing file will be overridden.

See Also: @RenameFile, @DeleteFile, @FileExists
CopyFile.shortDesc: Copies a file to a given destination

CopyFolder.desc:
CopyFolder copies a folder and its contents to a given destination. If an item already exists in the destination it will not be overwritten unless overwrite is true.

**Note:** <js nobox>CopyFolder(fld1, fld2)</js> will copy the **contents** of _fld1_ to _fld2_.

See Also: @RenameFolder, @DeleteFolder, @FolderExists
CopyFolder.shortDesc: Copies a folder to a given destination

Clear.desc: Clears the Bluetooth buffer of the serial connection.

Connect.desc: Connect to a Bluetooth device via its address. The oppenent must have called bt.Listen before.

Disconnect.desc: Disconnect your device from an eventually existant connection. Calls the OnDisconnect callback function on both devices.

IsConnected.desc: Checks if a Bluetooth connection exists to another device.

IsPaired.desc: Checks if a specific device is paired using its Bt name.
IsPaired.shortDesc: Check pairing status to another device

Listen.desc: Listen to your serial connection for any incoming mesages by passing true as first argument, or stop listening by passing false. It has to be called before an other device can connect with yours via bt.Connect.

RequestEnable.desc: If Bluetooth is disabled, shows an android dialog which asks the user to enable bluetooth connection. If granted, bluetooth will be enabled automatically. No callback fired.

SetDataMode.desc: Enable sending data in several modes.
pTypes: str-Hex:comma separated text value|Int:comma separated byte numbers|Text:string of text characters|<encoding:"UTF-16L/BE">
SetDataMode.shortDesc: Define data format for outgoing data

SetOnConnect.desc:
If the device has sent the connection request
	name is of type boolean (true if the connection was established successful)
	and address is your BluetoothSerial object

if the device has received the connection request
	name is a string with the clients bluetooth name
	and address includes the bluetooth address.

SetOnDisconnect.desc: SetOnDisconnect will be called on both devices after disconnecting from an existing bluetooth connection.

SetOnReceive.desc: The SetOnReceive callback is called automatically after data has been received via the Bluetooth serial connection.
SetOnReceive.shortDesc: Called after received Data via Bluetooth

Tells the serial listener how to split received data. Splitted data will result in multiple OnReceive calls. p2 and p3 have different purposes for different modes:
modep1p2
SizeSize of one data package-
EndByte indicating end of data-
Start-EndByte indicating start of dataByte indicating end of data
SetSplitMode.shortDesc: Specify how to split received data

Automatically takes pictures if a motion was detected by cam.[MotionMosaic]{switchPopup(this, 'MotionMosaic')}.
The first # in the filename is a placeholder for numbers increasing for every taken picture.

ReadColorSensor.desc:
Read a color sensor value on the input where the sensor is plugged into.

In “ColorDetect” mode this function returns a value between 1 and 6 which represent the colors “black”, “blue”, “green”, “yellow”, “red”, or “white”.
You can use the ToColorName function to convert from these six values to a color name.
All other modes return a value between 0 and 1023.

Creates a wallpaper instance in the wallpaper.js script.

SetErrorPage.desc: Define a url loaded when an error occured.

SetTouchMode.desc: Set the control in touch mode.

SetUserCreds.desc: Set login data for websites that require authentication.

SimulateKey.desc:
Simulates a key event on an app object.

You can find the complete list of key names on the [Android Developer Page](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/view/KeyEvent#KEYCODE_0).

GetLayout.desc: Return s the content layout:dso-"CreateLayout" object of the wizard.

SetBackColor.desc: Changes the background color of the control.

SetButtonText.desc: Changes the texts of the two Yes/No buttons.

SetOnTouch.desc: %cb% the user touches one of the buttons, passing either “Yes” or “No” to the callback function
SetOnTouch.shortDesc: Called when user selects Yes or No

CreateZipUtil.desc: The ZipUtil is handy for creating, editing and extracting zip files. You can even add files or texts to existing zip files, list their contents and extract single files from them.

AddFile.desc: Adds a file to the zip relative to the zip root.

AddText.desc: Adds some text to the zip relative to the zip root.

Extract.desc: Extract a single file from the zip to a gived destination.

List.desc: Returns a list of the files contained in the zip.

Open.desc: Opens an already existing zip file.

Sign.desc: Signs and checks the zip against the keystore file and returns if it is ok.
Sign.shortDesc: Sign and check zip against keystore file

Debug.desc:
This function is an app equivalent to console.log(msg) which writes text into a console visible in debug mode “true” or “console”.

See Also: @SetDebug

DeleteDatabase.desc:
DeleteDatabase removes a specific database

See Also: @OpenDatabase

DeleteFile.desc:
DeleteFile deletes a given file from the filesystem. This makes it hard to restore it!

See Also: @WriteFile, @RenameFile, @FileExists

DeleteFolder.desc:
DeleteFolder does the same as DeleteFile but with folders. It recursively removes all files and folders of the given folder and finally deletes it.

See Also: @MakeFolder, @RenameFolder, @FolderExists

DestroyLayout.desc:
DestroyLayout destroys a layout and all its contents so it can't be used any more. As a result, all memory occupied by these objects will be released.

See Also: @CreateLayout, @AddLayout

DisableTouch.desc:
Use this method to prevent any user interaction with the app.
You could use this for a safe mode for a slideshow.

DownloadFile.shortDesc: Download a file with Androids download manager

Error.desc:
Shows a detailed error message with message, file and line in an asynchroneous dialog. You can also set it to quit the app after the user dismisses the dialog.

See Also: @Alert

Execute.desc: Executes a piece of code asynchroneously to your program. It is designed for interacting with your main app from within a [WebView](CreateWebView.htm).
Execute.shortDesc: Execute js code from your app or a WebWiew

Exit.desc: With Exit you can cancel and completely stop the app. You can also forcefully **kill** the app by passing true as first argument.

ExtExec.shortDesc: Execute a bash script using Termux

ExtractAssets.desc: ExtractAssets allows to extract folders and files from your compiled APK to the local storage. But it works for local DroidScript projects as well. When override is false, already existant files will be kept and not overridden.
ExtractAssets.shortDesc: Extract app assets to a local directory

ExtractPlugins.desc:
ExtractPlugins overrides old plugin versions in the app's private folder with newer versions shipped with the APK.

This function is for debug purposes to forcefully update the plugins of an app even if the APK version did not change.

FileExists.desc:
FileExists Checks if a given file exists in your filesystem or not.

See Also: @WriteFile, @CopyFile, @RenameFile

FolderExists.desc:
Checks if a given folder exits or not.

See Also: @MakeFolder, @CopyFolder, @RenameFolder

Func.desc: Call main app functions from inside a webview

GetAccessibility.desc: Returns information about the availability of several accesibility features on the device.

GetAccounts.desc:
Returns a string of all known account names on the device separated with comma ','.

See Also: @ChooseAccount

GetActivities.desc:
GetActivities returns a list of object of currently running activities.

See Also: @GetRunningApps, @GetRunningServices

GetAppName.desc: Returns the name of the current app.

GetAppPath.desc:
Returns the path to the app assets folder. In a DroidScript project the path should be “/sdcard/DroidScript/APPNAME”
In an apk it instead returns the absolute path to the “/Assets” folder

See Also: @GetPath, @GetPrivateFolder

GetBatteryLevel.desc:
Returns the current battery level of the device in percent.

See Also: @GetChargeType, @IsCharging

GetBluetoothAddress.desc:
Returns the hexadecimal Bluetooth address of the device, following the pattern “00:00:00:00:00:00”.

See Also: @CreateBluetoothSerial

GetBluetoothName.desc:
Returns the Bluetooth name of the device.

See Also: @CreateBluetoothSerial

GetBtProfileState.desc:
Returns the Bluetooth State of a given Bt connection type.

See Also: @CreateBluetoothSerial

GetBuildNum.desc: GetBuildNum returns the build number of an APK.

GetChargeType.desc:
Returns the current charge type. If the device isn't charging the result is “None”.

See Also: @GetBatteryLevel, @IsCharging

GetClipboardText.desc:
GetClipboardText returns text that was last copied to the clipboard.

See Also: @SetClipboardText

GetCountry.desc:
Returns the name of the device country (ie. “United Kingdom” or “Deutschland”)

See Also: @GetCountryCode, 

See Also: @GetLanguage

GetCountryCode.desc:
Returns the code of the device country (ie. “GB” or “DE”)

See Also: @GetCountry, GetLanguageCode

GetData.desc:
Returns data stored via app.SetData(key, value). All data will be lost when the app is closed.

See Also: @SetData

GetDatabaseFolder.desc:
Returns the path to the database folder of the app. An example pattern is “/data/data/packageName/databases”.

See Also: @OpenDatabase

GetDefaultOrientation.desc:
Returns the default Orientation of the device. The result modes can be “Portrait” if the device width is smaller than the device height, or “Landscape” vice versa.

See Also: @SetOrientation, @GetOrientation

GetDeviceId.desc: Returns the alphanumeric ID of the device which is different for each device

GetDisplayHeight.desc:
Get the display height of the app in pixels. Therefore the android status bar and virtual buttons won't be included to the value.

See Also: @GetDisplayWidth, @GetScreenHeight

GetDisplayWidth.desc:
Get the display width of the app in pixels. Therefore virtual buttons won't be included to the value.

See Also: @GetDisplayHeight, @GetScreenWidth

GetDrawerState.desc:
Returns the current drawer state of a drawer on a given side.

See Also: @OpenDrawer, @CloseDrawer, @AddDrawer

GetDSVersion.desc: Returns the current DroidScript version number in the format 0.00.

GetEnv.desc: Returns the value of an environment variable defined on the device.

GetExternalFolder.desc:
GetExternalFolder returns the path to the external micro sdcard of the device. Normally it is something like “/storage/extsd” or “/storage/extSdCard”

See Also: @GetInternalFolder

GetFileDate.desc: GetFileDate returns a Date object containing the last modified date of a file or folder.
GetFileDate.shortDesc: Get last modified date of a file or folder

GetFileSize.desc: GetFileSize returns the size of a file or folder in bytes
GetFileSize.shortDesc: Get the size of a file or folder

GetFreeSpace.desc: Returns the free space of the internal or external storage in GigaBytes.

GetInstalledApps.desc:
Returns a list of objects containing informations about installed apps.

See Also: @GetRunningApps, @GetRunningServices
GetInstalledApps.retval: lst-[{ packageName:str, className:str, uid:num_int, targetSdkVersion:num_int, dataDir:str_pth, sourceDir:str_pth, publicSourceDir:str_pth, nativeLibraryDir:str_pth }]

GetIntent.desc:
Returns an intent object sent to the app.

See Also: @SendIntent
GetIntent.retval: obj-{ action:str, type:str, data:str, flags:num_int, extras: { app_intent:str, app_file:str_pth, app_options:str } }

GetInternalFolder.desc:
Get devices internal “/sdcard/” path. Normally it should be “/storage/emulated/legacy”.

See Also: @GetExternalFolder

GetIPAddress.desc: GetIPAddress returns the current network ip address. It should look like “0.0.0.0” which is the default value for disabled internet connection. The individual numbers can have values between 0 and 255.

GetJoystickName.desc:
Returns the name of a conected joystick.

See Also: @GetJoystickState

GetJoystickStates.desc:
Returns an object with all keystates.

See Also: @GetJoystickState

GetKeyboardHeight.desc:
Returns the height of the device keyboard in pixels. Returns _0_ if the keyboard is hidden.

See Also: @ShowKeyboard

GetLanguage.desc:
GetLanguage returns the name of the devices language (ie. “English” or “Deutsch”).
%c

See Also: @GetLanguageCode, @GetCountry

GetAppLanguages.desc:
Returns the available translation languages specified in your lang.json file.

See Also: @SetAppLanguage

GetLanguageCode.desc:
GetLanguageCode returns the user language code (ie. “en” or “de”).

See Also: @GetLanguage, @GetCountryCode

GetMacAddress.desc: Returns the alphanumeric **M**edia-**A**ccess-**C**ontrol address of the device. Style should be “00:00:00:00:00:00”. The individual numbers can have hexadecimal values between 00 and FF.

GetMediaFile.desc:
Returns a file path to a unique media file matching the format “/storage/emulated/0/Pictures/[**folder**]/**YYYYMMDD**_**hhmmSSsss**[**ext**]”. The folder for this file will be created automatically.

See Also: @CreateImage, @CreateCameraView
GetMediaFile.shortDesc: Get a path to an unambiguous media file

GetMemoryInfo.desc: Returns an object containing informations about the RAM memory.

GetMetadata.desc:
Returns a string list of metadata values contained in an audio file.

See Also: @CreateMediaPlayer

GetModel.desc: Returns the model name of the device.

GetName.desc: Returns the name of the APK application. meaning if your app runs in DroidScript, the name will be “DroidScript” as well.

GetNotifyId.desc:
If the app was started by a notification, this function will return the id of that notification.

See Also: @CreateNotification

GetObjects.desc: Returns a map of DroidScript control objects with their id as key.
GetObjects.shortDesc: Get map of created DroidScript objects

GetOptions.desc:
Returns all current app settings. If ran from inside DroidScript, “debug,remote,holo” is the default value.

See Also: @SetOptions

GetOrientation.desc:
Returns the current device orientation. The result modes can be “Portrait” if the device width is smaller than the device height, or “Landscape” vice versa.

See Also: @SetOrientation, @GetDefaultOrientation, @GetRotation

GetOSVersion.desc: GetOSVersion returns the API target level  of the android version.

GetPackageName.desc: Returns the package name of the APK.

GetPairedBtDevices.desc:
Returns a list of objects containing the name and bluetooth address of paired devices. Note that Bluetooth must be turned on to receive this information.

See Also: @UnpairBtDevice, @CreateBluetoothSerial, @DiscoverBtDevices
GetPairedBtDevices.shortDesc: Get list of paired bluetooth devices

GetPath.desc:
Returns the path to the local storage folder of the APK.

See Also: @GetAppPath, @GetPrivateFolder

GetPermission.desc:
GetPermission accepts a list of 'dangerus' classified permissions and returns a list of ungranted permissions in the **callback** function, or in case of only “ExtSDCard” the path URI of the user-selected folder.

See Also: @CheckPermission

GetPrivateFolder.desc:
Returns the path to a folder located in the apps private space which is normally not accessible by other apps or the user himself.

See Also: @GetAppPath, @GetPath
GetPrivateFolder.shortDesc: Get path to a private folder

GetResourceId.desc:
Returns the id of a resource.

See Also: @LoadPlugin

GetRingerMode.desc:
Returns the current ringer mode of the device which can be “Normal”, “Vibrate” or “Silent”.

See Also: @SetRingerMode

GetRotation.desc:
Returns the current rotation of the device around it's Z-Axis in 90 degree steps. The values are relative to the initial orientation of the device on startup.

See Also: @GetOrientation

GetRouterAddress.desc: Returns the routers ip address. (Its typically your own IP but ending with a .1, ie. 192.168.178.1)

GetRunningApps.desc:
Returns a list of objects containing info about all currently running apps in the fore- or background.

See Also: @GetRunningServices, @GetInstalledApps

GetRunningServices.desc:
Returns a list of objects containing info about all currently running services in the background.

See Also: @GetRunningApps, @GetInstalledApps

GetScreenDensity.desc:
Returns the density of the device's screen.

See Also: @GetScreenWidth, @GetScreenHeight, @SetDensity

GetScreenHeight.desc:
Returns the total screen height of the device in pixels. With the 'Real' **option** softkeys will be included in the value.

See Also: @GetScreenWidth, @GetScreenDensity

GetScreenWidth.desc:
Returns the total screen width of the device in pixels. With the 'Real' **option** softkeys will be included in the value.

See Also: @GetScreenHeight, @GetScreenDensity

GetSharedFiles.desc:
Returns a path list of files shared with the app. If the results were retreived they can't be read an other time, unless they will be shared again.

See Also: @GetSharedText, @SendFile, @SendText

GetSharedText.desc:
Returns the value of a shared text. If the result is returned, it cannot be read another time unless it is shared again.

See Also: @GetSharedFiles, @SendFile, @SendText

GetSpeechEngines.desc:
Returns a list of installed tts engines.

See Also: @TextToSpeech

GetSpeakerPhone.desc:
Checks if the speaker is enabled for phone calls. Returns false if no call is active.

See also: @SetSpeakerPhone.

GetSpecialFolder.desc:
Returns the full path to a special folder commonly used for images, videos, music etc.

See Also: @GetPath, @GetAppPath, @WriteFile
GetSpecialFolder.shortDesc: Get full path to a special media folder

GetSSID.desc:
Returns the name (SSID) of the current network the user is connected with. If WiFi is disabled “<unknown ssid>” is returned.

See Also: @IsWifiEnabled, @SetWifiEnabled, @WifiConnect

GetTextBounds.desc: Calculates text dimensions based on a specific control or with default settings

GetThemeInfo.desc: Returns the configuration of the current theme.
GetThemeInfo.retval: obj-{ baseTheme:str, holo:bin, dark:bin, titleHeight:num_frc, backColor:str_col, dialogColor:str_col, btnColor:str_col, dialogBtnColor:str_col, textColor1:str_col, textColor2:str_col,btnTextColor:str_col, highlightColor:str_col }

GetThumbnail.desc:
Creates a downscaled copy of an existing image. Pass -1 as width or height to keep the aspect ratio.

See Also: @CreateImage
GetThumbnail.shortDesc: Create downscaled copy of an image

GetTop.desc: Returns the upper border distance from the app display to the device screen as height relative float or in pixels with the **px** option.

GetUser.desc:
Returns the email-address of the currently active user account.

See Also: @GetAccounts

GetVersion.desc: Returns the app version number of the currently running apk.

GetVolume.desc:
Returns the volume level of a given audio type as a number between 0 and 1. By default the “System” volume is returned.

See Also: @SetVolume
GetVolume.shortDesc: Get volume of a given audio type

GoToSleep.desc:
Forces the screen to turn off and puts the device to sleep. (This has the same effect as pressing the power button)

See Also: @WakeUp
GoToSleep.shortDesc: Puts the phone into sleep mode

HasSoftNav.desc: Checks if the device has a soft navigation bar on the screen.
HasSoftNav.shortDesc: Checks if device has soft keys

Hide.desc:
Hides the main app layout in order to save performance when (re)creating controls.

See Also: @Show

HideKeyboard.desc:
Hides the device keyboard if it is currently shown.

See Also: @ShowKeyboard, @SetOnShowKeyboard

HideProgress.desc:
Hides a previously shown progress indicator.
See also @ShowProgress.

HideProgressBar.desc:
Hides a previously shown progress bar dialog.
See also @ShowProgressBar, @UpdateProgressBar.

HttpRequest.desc:
HttpRequest sends a request to a server. baseUrl and path will just be added to one string to get the address.
Multiple parameters are available using pipes:
	“param1=value1|param2=value2”
pTypes: str-GET:retrieve data|POST:submit data|JSON:post json data|PUT:replace target resource|DELETE:deletes the resource|HEAD:omit body

InstallWallpaper.desc:
Let the user install a device wallpaper located in the 'Wallpaper.js' script in the project root folder.

<premium>

See also @CreateWallpaper.

InstallApp.desc: Starts the installation process of an apk file from your local drive.

IsAPK.desc: Returns whether current app is an APK or not (case not it's a DroidScript Project).
IsAPK.shortDesc: Returns true if ran from apk

IsAppInstalled.desc:
Checks if an app given by a package name is installed.

See also: @GetPackageName, @GetInstalledApps

IsBluetoothEnabled.desc:
Return whether bluetooth was enabled. 

See Also: @SetBluetoothEnabled

IsBluetoothOn.desc:
Checks if bluetooth is enabled and on.

See Also: @CreateBluetoothSerial, @DiscoverBtDevices

IsBtDevicePaired.desc:
Checks if a given bluetooth device was paired with the user device.

See Also: @GetPairedBtDevices, @UnpairBtDevice
IsBtDevicePaired.shortDesc: Check bt paired state to other device

IsCharging.desc:
Checks if phone is currently charging or not.

See Also: @GetBatteryLevel, @GetChargeType

IsChrome.desc:
Checks if the device is running on ChromeOS.

See Also: @IsTablet
IsChrome.shortDesc: Check if device OS is ChromeOS

IsConnected.desc:
Checks if the device is connected to any network.

See Also: @SetWifiEnabled, @WifiConnect, @SetOnWifiChange
IsConnected.shortDesc: Check if device is connected to any network

IsDebugging.desc:
Checks if the app is currently debugging.
See also @SetDebug, @Debug

IsFolder.desc:
Checks if the passed fs path leads to a folder.

See Also: @FolderExists, @FileExists
IsFolder.shortDesc: Check if path leads to a folder

IsKeyboardShown.desc:
Checks if the device keyboard is currently visible or not.

See Also: @ShowKeyboard, @HideKeyboard
IsKeyboardShown.shortDesc: Check whether device keyboard is shown

IsLocationEnabled.desc:
Checks if a specific location mode was enabled.

See Also: @CreateLocator
IsLocationEnabled.shortDesc: Check if location method is enabled

IsNavBarOnRight.desc: Checks if the Navigation Bar is on the righthand side of the display.
IsNavBarOnRight.shortDesc: Check if NavBar is on righthand side

IsNewVersion.desc: Checks if the apk version number increased compared to the last time started.

IsPortrait.desc: Checks if the device is in portrait mode.
IsPortrait.shortDesc: Check if device is in portrait mode

IsPremium.desc: Checks if the user has a DroidScript premium subscription inside the IDE.
IsPremium.shortDesc: Check if user has a DroidScript Premium subscription

IsScreenOn.desc: Checks if the device screen is currently on.
IsScreenOn.shortDesc: Check if device screen is on

IsService.desc: Checks if the currently running app instance is a service.
IsService.shortDesc: Check id app is a service

IsStarted.desc: Checks if the app has finished loading. It will return true after OnStart has returned.
IsStarted.shortDesc: Check if app has finished loading

IsTablet.desc:
Checks if the user device is a tablet.

See Also: @IsChrome
IsTablet.shortDesc: Check if user device is a tablet

IsTV.desc:
Checks if the OS is AndroidThings.

IsWifiApEnabled.desc:
Checks if the mobile Wifi Access Point is enabled on the user device.

See Also: @SetWifiApEnabled
IsWifiApEnabled.shortDesc: Check if the mobile Wifi Access Point is enabled

IsWifiEnabled.desc:
Checks if Wifi is enabled on the user device.

See Also: @SetWifiEnabled, @SetOnWifiChange, @IsWifiApEnabled

KillApp.desc: Kills a running app by its process ID. You can retreive a list of all running apps with their pids using the @GetRunningApps function of the **app** object.

GetAppLangCode.desc:
Convert the user language name to it's 2 character long language code. If no argument is passed, the current language code is returned.

See Also: @GetLanguage
GetAppLangCode.shortDesc: Convert language name to its code or get current language code

LaunchApp.desc: Launches an app if installed or search for it on GooglePlay otherwise.

ListPermissions.desc: Returns a list of granted permissions

LoadBoolean.desc:
Load a saved boolean value to remember varibale values between multiple app starts.

LoadNumber.desc:
Load a saved number value to remember varibale values between multiple app starts.

See also: @SaveNumber.

Load a saved json object to remember varibale values between multiple app starts.

Loads a local JavaScript file asynchronously to your app to make its functionality available in your app.

Load saved text value to remember varibale values between multiple app starts.

See also: @SaveText.

Locks the device.

See Also: @Unlock

Make drawer on a specific side unaccessible for the app and the user, hiding it if necessary. You can only unlock it using the @UnlockDrawer method.

See Also: @AddDrawer

MakeFolder.desc:
Creates a new folder in the local filesystem recursively.

See Also: @FolderExists

obj-{ length:num_int, rowsAffected:num_int, rows.item(i): { id:num, data:all, data_num:num } }

name.desc:
The database name
<deprecated use GetName instead>

pTypes: obj-{ db: { openargs: { name:str, dblocation:str }, dbname:str, name:str }, txlock:bin, readOnly:bin, executes: [{ success:str, qid:num_int, sql:str_sql, params:lst }] }

obj-{ db: { openargs: { name:str, dblocation:str }, dbname:str, name:str }, txlock:bin, readOnly:bin, executes: [{ success:str, qid:num_int, sql:str_sql, params:lst }] }

OpenDrawer.desc:
Opens the drawer layout on the given side with slide animation.

See Also: @AddDrawer

OpenFile.desc:
Allows the user to open a file with an external application on the device. The **choose** parameter shows the user a custom message in the choose dialog.

See also: @SendFile.
OpenFile.shortDesc: Allow user to open a file with an external app

OpenUrl.desc:
Allows the user to open an url with an external application on the device. The **choose** parameter shows the user a custom message in the choose dialog.

See Also: @CreateWebView, @OpenFile
OpenUrl.shortDesc: Allow user to open an url with an external app

Path2Uri.desc: Returns a content:// path for images and videos
Path2Uri.shortDesc: Convert file path to content uri

PairBtDevice.desc:
Pairs a bluetooth device with yours.

See Also: @GetPairedBtDevices, @IsBtDevicePaired, @DiscoverBtDevices

PinScreen.desc: Pins the app on the screen

PlayRingtone.desc: Play a specific ringtone type based on the users device settings for ringtones. _Type_ can be “Alarm”, “Notification” or “Ringtone”.

PlaySound.desc:
Plays a sound file stored remotely or on the local filesystem.

See Also: @CreateMediaPlayer
PlaySound.shortDesc: Plays a local or remote sound file

PreventScreenLock.desc: The _PreventScreenLock_ method prevents the device screen from dimming and locking while your app is in the foreground.
pTypes: bin||str-Full:Device can sleep, Screen and Keyboard on|Partial:CPU always on, Screen and Keyboard off
PreventScreenLock.shortDesc: Prevent screen from locking after some time

PreventWifiSleep.desc:
Prevent the device WiFi from powering down.

See Also: @SetWifiEnabled, @IsWifiEnabled

QueryContent.shortDesc: Queries content from the android content model

Quit.desc: Quits the app with showing an @Alert dialog box before exiting. The function will pause the program and exit before any further commands can be executed.
Quit.shortDesc: Quit the app with showing a dialog and exit after closing

ReadFile.desc:
Reads a file from the local filesystem and returns its contents.

See also: @WriteFile
ReadFile.shortDesc: Read the content of a local file

ReadFileData.desc:
Reads file data from the local filesystem and returns its contents.

See also: @WriteFile

RealPath.desc: Converts short file paths to full paths

RedirectAssets.desc: Reads the assets folders “Img”,“Snd”,“Html” and “Misc” from an external folder outside the apk.

RemoveDrawer.desc:
Removes a drawer layout from a given side.

See also: @AddDrawer
RemoveDrawer.shortDesc: Remove drawer layout from a given side

RemoveLayout.desc:
Removes a layout added to the app.

See also: @AddLayout

RenameFile.desc:
Renames a file on the local filesystem. This method can also be used to move a file to a whole other destination.

See Also: @WriteFile, @CopyFile, @DeleteFile
RenameFile.shortDesc: Rename or move a local file

RenameFolder.desc:
Renames a folder on the local filesystem. This method can also be used to move a folder to a whole other destination.

See Also: @MakeFolder, @CopyFolder, @DeleteFolder
RenameFolder.shortDesc: Rename or move a local folder

ReplaceInFile.desc: Replaces all occurances of some text or a regex pattern in a local file with some other text.
ReplaceInFile.shortDesc: Replace text in a local file

SaveBoolean.desc:
Save a boolean value to remember varibale values between multiple app starts.

See also: @LoadBoolean.
SaveBoolean.shortDesc: Save a boolean value across multiple starts

SaveCookies.desc:
Saves cookies for webviews or html apps.

See also: @ClearCookies

SaveNumber.desc:
Save a number value to remember varibale values between multiple app starts and updates.

See also: @LoadNumber.
SaveNumber.shortDesc: Save a number value across multiple starts

SaveJson.desc:
Save a json object to remember varibale values between multiple app starts and updates.

See also: @LoadNumber.
SaveJson.shortDesc: Save a json object across multiple starts

SaveText.desc:
Save a text value to remember varibale values between multiple app starts and updates.

See also: @LoadText.
SaveText.shortDesc: Save a text value across multiple starts

ScanFile.desc:
Forces android to scan an image file to appear in the phone's gallery.

See also: @CreateImage, @CreateCameraView, @ScreenShot.
ScanFile.shortDesc: Adds media files to phone gallery

ScreenShot.desc:
Takes a screen shot of your app and saves it to the specified path. Quality is an **option**al percentage value for jpg files defaulting to 95.

See also: @GetMediaFile
ScreenShot.shortDesc: Take a screen shot of your app

ScheduleJob.desc:
Schedules background jobs defined in a Job.js file

See Also: @CancelJob

Script.desc:
Loads a local JavaScript file to your app to make its functionality available in your app.
By default it is loaded just before OnStart is being called unless you set “NoDefer” to <js>true</js> which forces inline loading.
This is to ensure errors are highlighted correctly in external source files.

See Also: @LoadScript

SendFile.shortDesc: Send a file to a remote target

SendImage.shortDesc: Send an image to a remote target

pTypes: obj-{ action:string, type:str, data:string, flags:integer, extras:object }

SendMail.shortDesc: Open the EMail app and autofill fields

SendMessage.desc: Send a message from a Service to the main app.
SendMessage.shortDesc: Send message from Service to main app

SendSMS.desc:
Send an SMS to someone using the default SMS application. The passed argumets will be auto-filled or requested by the SMS app otherwise. %c

See Also: @SendMail, @SendText, @SendFile
SendSMS.shortDesc: Open the SMS app and autofill fields

SetAlarm.desc: Set a time when you want your app to start automatically if it is not already opened. When the alarm is fired, the global _OnAlarm_ event will be fired.
pTypes: str_com-ExactIdle|Exact:only works for single shot alarms,App:Opens main app if called from a service
SetAlarm.shortDesc: Set alarm to open your app at a specific time

SetAutoBoot.desc:
Causes the current running APK or its Service to be started automatically when your device boots.

See Also: @SetAutoStart

SetAutoStart.desc:
Set a DroidScript project name which will be launched automatically when DroidScript starts.

<deprecated in favour of ide.AutoStart>

See Also: @SetSharedApp, @SetAutoBoot
SetAutoStart.shortDesc: Autostart DroidScript Project on DS restart

SetAutoWifi.desc:
Automatically enables the use of the WiFi editor. This method is mainly useful for headless devices like AndroidTV which don't have a DroidScript UI.

<deprecated in favour of ide.AutoWifi>

SetBackColor.desc: Changes the background color of the app.

SetBluetoothEnabled.desc:
Enables Bluetooth on the device.

See Also: @IsBluetoothEnabled, @IsBluetoothOn, @CreateBluetoothSerial

SetClipboardText.desc:
The SetClipboardText method puts text data on the device clip board. This allows you to copy and paste text between different applications.

See Also: @GetClipboardText

SetData.desc:
Saves variables until the app closes. All saved data will be lost afterwards. %c

See Also: @GetData, @ClearData
SetData.shortDesc: Save data while app is running

SetDebug.shortDesc: Control the debug level of the program

SetDensity.desc:
Changes the dpi value (dots per inch) that affects the content of any control created afterwards. The smaller the value, the smaller the scaling.

See Also: @GetScreenDensity
SetDensity.shortDesc: Changes the dpi value for any control creatred afterwards

SetInBackground.desc:
Set the current service to run in the background.

See Also: @StartService, @SetInForeground.
SetInBackground.shortDesc: Set services to run in the background

SetInForeground.desc:
Set the current service to run in the foreground.

See Also: @StartService, @SetInBackground
SetInForeground.shortDesc: Set services to run in the foreground

pTypes: str_com-ForwardKeys:allows the joystick key presses to pass onto the child controls of the main activity
SetJoystickOptions.shortDesc: Set options for the connected joystick

SetKioskMode.desc:
Blocks android functionality to keep the rest of your phone safe while others may use your app.

<premium>
<xfeature>
SetKioskMode.shortDesc: Blocks android functionality outside your app

SetAppLanguage.desc:
Loads the current language code from the lang.json file in your project root folder. Make sure you use the [standard 2 letter language codes](http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php).

See Also: @GetAppLanguages
SetAppLanguage.shortDesc: Load the language code from lang.json

SetMenu.desc:
Set the app menu fields. When a menu entry is touched, the global _OnMenu_ event will be called.

See Also: @ShowMenu

SetMargins.desc: Set the default margins settings for controls

SetMockLocation.desc:
Emulates a GPS location on the device.

<premium>

SetOnBroadcast.desc:
Define a callback function for incoming Broadcast messages.
You can find [a list of broadcasts available for android SDK ver. 28 here](https://chromium.googlesource.com/android\_tools/+/refs/heads/master/sdk/platforms/android-28/data/broadcast\_actions.txt)


See also: @Broadcast

SetOnDebug.desc:
Define a callback function for debug messages.

See also: @Debug, @SetDebug

SetOnError.desc:
Define a callback function to catch thrown errors messages.

See also: @Error

SetOnKey.shortDesc: Catch key events fired in your app

SetOnShowKeyboard.desc:
Define a callback function to detect when keyboard visible state has changed.

See Also: @ShowKeyboard, @HideKeyboard

SetOnWifiChange.desc:
Define a callback function to detect when the WiFi connected state has changed. The **state** parameter can be “CONNECTING”, “CONNECTED”, or “DISCONNECTED”. The WiFi ssid is passed on “CONNECTED” only.

See Also: @WifiConnect, @WifiScan
SetOnWifiChange.shortDesc: Called on WiFi connected state changes

SetOptions.desc:
Define some global options for the app.

See Also: @GetOptions

SetOrientation.desc:
Set the display orientation to a fixed value. You can unlock it again passing “Default” as **orientation**.

See Also: @GetOrientation

SetPosition.desc: Change the main app's position and size. Mostly used for transparent apps.

SetRingerMode.desc:
Change the current ringer mode of the device which can be “Normal”, “Vibrate” or “Silent”.

See Also: @GetRingerMode

SetScreenBrightness.desc: Change the screen brightness to a value between 0 and 1, where 0 is the lowest and 1 the highest possible brightness value.

SetScreenMode.desc: Changes the screen mode of your application. If null is passed, the [app menu](SetMenu.htm) will be dismissed. When called, the global OnConfig function will be called (if defined).

SetSharedApp.desc:
Define a DroidScript Project which will be automatically started when DS received shared data. Check out the 'Shared Data' sample in the DS samples section.

See Also: @SetAutoStart
SetSharedApp.shortDesc: Auto-Launch Project when shared data received

SetSpeakerPhone.desc:
En/Disables the speaker for phone calls.

See also: @GetSpeakerPhone.

SetStatusBarColor.desc:
Change the android status bar color.

<premium>

SetTextSize.desc: Set the default text size setting for controls
pTypes: str-px|dip|sp|mm|pt|pl:scales text in proportion with device resolution|ps:scales text in proportion with device resolution

SetTheme.desc:
Change the theme of your app to any created [Theme Object](CreateTheme.htm). The theme will only apply to objects created after the theme was set. You typically need to recreate all your controls or restart the app to apply the new theme.

<premium>

SetUserAgent.desc: Change the user agent for html apps. For more details [ask Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User_agent).

SetUserCreds.desc: Set user credentials in an html app for websites that require user login.

SetVolume.desc:
Set the volume of a given volume type as a number between 0 and 1.

See Also: @GetVolume
SetVolume.shortDesc: Change volume of a given audio type

SetWifiApEnabled.shortDesc: En/Disable the mobile Wifi Access Point of the device

SetWifiEnabled.desc:
En/Disable Wifi on the device.

See Also: @SetWifiEnabled, @IsWifiApEnabled, @WifiScan

Show.desc:
Shows the main app layout.

See Also: @Hide

ShowCheckList.desc: The check list provides a similar functionality to the “Multi” [ListDiaog](CreateListDialog.htm), although you can adjust its initial check states with an object structure.
pTypes: str-sun-moon:shows sun and moon icons instead of default check boxes

ShowDebug.desc:
Show/Hide the debug console as overlay in your app, after calling @CreateDebug.

See Also: @Debug

ShowKeyboard.desc:
Shows the keyboard on a focussed control.

See Also: @HideKeyboard
ShowKeyboard.shortDesc: Show keyboard on a focussed control

ShowMenu.desc:
Show the in-app menu. When a menu entry is touched, the _OnMenu_ event will be called.

See Also: @SetMenu

ShowPopup.desc: Shows a simple popup message on the screen. It automatically disappears after about 5 secods or after an even shorter time if you pass the “Short” **option**, or when the user touches the screen.

ShowProgress.desc: Shows a rotating progress circle indicating that something happens and that the user should keep his extremities with him until the process completed.
pTypes: str_com-NoDim:Don't darken background,NonModal:allow background touch,Solid:shows solid background behind spinner

ShowProgressBar.desc:
Shows a dialog with a bar indicating the current progress of a certain thing.

See Also: @UpdateProgressBar, @HideProgressBar

ShowTextDialog.desc: Shows a text input dialog with a title to allow the user to input some text.

ShowTip.desc: Shows a tooltip message on the screen.

SimulateDrag.desc: Simulates a drag event on an app object in a scrollable container.

SimulateKey.desc:
Simulates a key event on an app object.

You can find the complete list of key names on the [Android Developer Page](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/view/KeyEvent#KEYCODE_0)

SimulateScroll.desc: Simulates a scroll event on a scrollable app object.

SimulateTouch.desc: Simulates a touch event on a rouchable control.
SimulateTouch.shortDesc: Simulate a touch event on a rouchable control

Start.desc: Starts your DS app in an html project. Call it in the document.onload function in order to initialize DroidScript and execute your OnStart() function.
Start.shortDesc: Start your DS app in an html project

StartApp.desc:
Starts an app in a new window. **Note:** This function does only work in APKs because in the IDE your app is already running.

See Also: @StopApp
pTypes: str_com-Portrait|Landscape,Transparent,Debug:start app in debug mode,Game:runs in GameView mode|remote
StartApp.shortDesc: Starts an app in a new window

StartDebugServer.desc:
Starts a debug server which can be used to debug your app on headless devices.

See Also: @StopDebugServer

StartService.desc:
Starts a service which runs parallel to your app.

See Also: @StopService.

StopDebugServer.desc:
Stops a running debug server.

See Also: @StartDebugServer

SysExec.desc:
Executes a shell command on the android shell. **NOTE:** You have to add a '`exit`' command at the end of your script because the shell does not terminate automatically after finishing.

See Also: @ExtExec
pTypes: str-log:logs output to console,noread:dont read result (just execute),sh|su
SysExec.shortDesc: Execute a shell command on the android shell

ToBack.desc:
Hides the app but continue running it in the background. If called, the global _OnPause_ event will be fired and if reshown, _OnResume_ is fired.

See Also: @ToFront
ToBack.shortDesc: Put the app in the background

ToFront.desc:
Brings the app back to the foreground.

See Also: @ToBack.
ToFront.shortDesc: Bring your app to the foreground

Translate.desc: Translates “Ok” and “Cancel” buttons created after this method to the passed strings.

Unlock.desc:
Unlocks the device.

<red>**Requires Root**</red>

See Also: @Lock

UnlockDrawer.desc:
Unlocks a locked drawer.
See Also @LockDrawer, @AddDrawer

UnpairBtDevice.desc:
Unpairs a paired Bluetooth device by its bt address. The _callback_ argument is called when the device was successfully unpaired.

See Also: @PairBtDevice, @GetPairedBtDevices, @DiscoverBtDevices, @CreateBluetoothSerial

UnzipFile.desc:
Extracts the contents of a zip file to a given target folder.

See Also: @ZipFolder, @ZipFile

UpdateProgressBar.desc:
Updates the progress percentage of a ProgressBar.
See Also: @ShowProgressBar, @HideProgressBar.

UpdateUI.desc: Force an UI refresh during a very time consuming calculation.

UploadFile.desc: Uploads a file to a server.
UploadFile.shortDesc: Uploads a file to a server

Uri2Path.desc:
Decodes a URI encoded string.

See Also: @SetOnError

Vibrate.desc:
Makes the device vibrate in a specified pattern in millisecond values:
“pause:num\_mls,play:num\_mls,pause:num\_mls,play:num\_mls,...”

WakeUp.desc:
Forces the screen to turn on the screen. (This has the same effect as pressing the power button in sleep mode)

See Also: @GoToSleep

WalkFolder.desc: Lists a directory recursively similar to app.@ListFolder
pTypes: str_com-Alphasort:sorts the paths in alphabetical order,FullPath:returns absolute paths to the listed items,RegEx:accepts regexp patterns,Folders:list folders only,Files:list files only,NoEmpty:hide empty folders,project:Shows DS project folders only
WalkFolder.shortDesc: Lists the contents of a folder recursively

WifiConnect.desc: Connect to a WiFi network by specifying the ssid and a password. See Also: @WifiScan, @SetOnWifiChange, @SetWifiApEnabled

WifiScan.desc: Scans the surroundings for any available Wifi networks.
WifiScan.shortDesc: Scan for any available Wifi networks

WriteFile.desc:
Writes text to a local file.

See Also: @ReadFile.
WriteFile.shortDesc: Write text to a local file

ZipFile.desc:
Compresses a local file to a zip file.

See Also: @ZipFolder

ZipFolder.desc:
Recursively compresses a local folder to a zip file.

See Also: @ZipFile, @UnzipFile
